protocol_name: ATAC-seq on nuclei from frozen, sliced, Drosophila melanogaster embryo halves
protocol_name_html: ATAC-seq on nuclei from frozen, sliced, Drosophila melanogaster embryo halves
description:
Protocol for performing ATAC-seq on nuclei isolated from Drosophila melanogaster stage 5 embryos that were flash frozen and then cut in half along the anterior-posterior midline. Data from this protocol are presented in the following paper: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2017/09/27/195073.

 

This protocol is based adapted from the following sources:  https://www.nature.com/nmeth/journal/v10/n12/full/nmeth.2688.html and http://journals.plos.org/plosgenetics/article?
warning:
• Always wear proper PPE 
  • Be careful to not get frostbite when working with dry ice. Double glove when handling the chilled scalpel.

components.data: Solutions
components.name: Section

components.data:
Lysis Buffer NO detergent

  • 10mM Tris-Hcl, pH 7.4
  • 10mM NaC1
  •  3mM MgCl2

Store at 4dC- make fresh weekly

 

Lysis Buffer Freezing Media

  • 10ml Lysis Buffer No Detergent
  • 1ml of 50% glycerol
  • 1ul of bromoblue dye

Lysis Buffer + Spermine

  • 10ml Lysis Buffer No Detergent
  • 0.15mM spermine
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Lysis Buffer NO detergent

  • 10mM Tris-Hcl, pH 7.4
  • 10mM NaC1
  •  3mM MgCl2

Store at 4dC- make fresh weekly

 

Lysis Buffer Freezing Media

  • 10ml Lysis Buffer No Detergent
  • 1ml of 50% glycerol
  • 1ul of bromoblue dye

Lysis Buffer + Spermine

  • 10ml Lysis Buffer No Detergent
  • 0.15mM spermine

components.data: Embryo Collection
components.name: Section

components.data: Several hundred adult OregonR Drosophila melanogaster (http://flybase.org/reports/FBsn0000276.html)  were put into a fly cage at 25°C for three days. Flies are fed with standard molasses plates a spread of yeast paste. Embryos were collected for 2 hours and then aged at 25°C for an hour and thirty minutes. This should yield embryos between 2:00 and 3:30 hours old.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Several hundred adult OregonR Drosophila melanogaster (http://flybase.org/reports/FBsn0000276.html)  were put into a fly cage at 25°C for three days. Flies are fed with standard molasses plates a spread of yeast paste. Embryos were collected for 2 hours and then aged at 25°C for an hour and thirty minutes. This should yield embryos between 2:00 and 3:30 hours old.

components.data: Bleach embryos for 3 minutes in 30%-50% bleach to remove the chorion. Rinse well with water. Pat dry on towel. Rinse with 1xPBS + 0.5% Triton. Brush embryos into an 1.5ml tube filled with 1xPBS + 0.5% Triton. Let embryos settle. Then use a pipette tip to transfer a drop of embryos to a slide.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Bleach embryos for 3 minutes in 30%-50% bleach to remove the chorion. Rinse well with water. Pat dry on towel. Rinse with 1xPBS + 0.5% Triton. Brush embryos into an 1.5ml tube filled with 1xPBS + 0.5% Triton. Let embryos settle. Then use a pipette tip to transfer a drop of embryos to a slide.

components.data: Stage the embryos to the desired age. We usually go for Stage 5.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Stage the embryos to the desired age. We usually go for Stage 5.

components.data: Place staged embryos into ependorf tubes containing Lysis buffer freezing media.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place staged embryos into ependorf tubes containing Lysis buffer freezing media.

components.data: Freezing and Slicing Embryos
components.name: Section

components.data: Once embryos are frozen, immediately transfer the slide to a cold block that has been chilled. I surround the block with dry ice to keep it cool. Additionally it is necessary to cool down the scalpel on dry ice before cutting. I leave the scalpel and 2 poker tools in dry ice while cutting to keep them cold. Be sure to wear gloves and keep the scalpal handle away from the dry ice to keep hands warm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once embryos are frozen, immediately transfer the slide to a cold block that has been chilled. I surround the block with dry ice to keep it cool. Additionally it is necessary to cool down the scalpel on dry ice before cutting. I leave the scalpel and 2 poker tools in dry ice while cutting to keep them cold. Be sure to wear gloves and keep the scalpal handle away from the dry ice to keep hands warm.

components.data: Keep the slides, poker tool, and scalpel on dry ice to keep from melting.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Keep the slides, poker tool, and scalpel on dry ice to keep from melting.

source_data.reagent_name: Shandon™ Straight Point Teasing Needles, Straight Point, Wooden Handle, 5.5 in. (14.0cm)
Fisherbrand™ High Precision #10 Style Scalpel Blade

components.data: Underneath a dissection scope, space out staged embryos on the glass slide such that they are evenly separated and can be cut easily with the blade. I affix a grid pattern to the bottom side of the glass slide to offer contrast to the white embryos.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Underneath a dissection scope, space out staged embryos on the glass slide such that they are evenly separated and can be cut easily with the blade. I affix a grid pattern to the bottom side of the glass slide to offer contrast to the white embryos.

components.data: Once the embryos are lined up on a slide, gently place the slide on dry ice for 2-5 minutes while you prepare the next slide. The embryos will turn from clear to completely white when frozen. I usually line up 10 embryos / slide and slice 5-6 slides at a time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once the embryos are lined up on a slide, gently place the slide on dry ice for 2-5 minutes while you prepare the next slide. The embryos will turn from clear to completely white when frozen. I usually line up 10 embryos / slide and slice 5-6 slides at a time.

components.data: Embryo Lysing
components.name: Section

components.data: Crush using a plastic pestle upwards of 20 times vigorously.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Crush using a plastic pestle upwards of 20 times vigorously.

components.data: After homogenization, rinse the pestle with 50ul of lysis buffer to make sure not to lose any material. This will bring the total volume up to 100ul.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After homogenization, rinse the pestle with 50ul of lysis buffer to make sure not to lose any material. This will bring the total volume up to 100ul.

components.data: Vortex slightly at low speed and spin down on a table top centrifuge.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex slightly at low speed and spin down on a table top centrifuge.

components.data: Add 1ul of 10% IGEPAL CA-630 drop-wise to a final concentration of 0.1%. Mix well by flicking tube with finger. Let sit for about 10 minutes
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1ul of 10% IGEPAL CA-630 drop-wise to a final concentration of 0.1%. Mix well by flicking tube with finger. Let sit for about 10 minutes

components.data: Spin in microcentrifuge at 800xg for 10 minutes at 4dC. Remove as much supernatant as possible to to avoid nuclei loss.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin in microcentrifuge at 800xg for 10 minutes at 4dC. Remove as much supernatant as possible to to avoid nuclei loss.

components.data: Resuspend nuclei in enough DNAse and RNAse free water for the transposition reaction (below).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend nuclei in enough DNAse and RNAse free water for the transposition reaction (below).

components.data: Once your tube contains the desired number of embryo halves, move on to isolate the nuclei.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Once your tube contains the desired number of embryo halves, move on to isolate the nuclei.

components.data:
Cut embryos along the midline with the dry ice chilled blade or scalpel. Move each half to a 1.5ml tube filled with 50ul of ATAC Lysis buffer + Spermine with the chilled poker tool.

 

  • The embryos will thaw and dissolve as soon as they are transfered. To reduce contamination, we use 2 poker tools, one to handle anterior halves and one to handle posterior halves. Additionally, we wash pokers in 70% EtOH between slices
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Cut embryos along the midline with the dry ice chilled blade or scalpel. Move each half to a 1.5ml tube filled with 50ul of ATAC Lysis buffer + Spermine with the chilled poker tool.

 

  • The embryos will thaw and dissolve as soon as they are transfered. To reduce contamination, we use 2 poker tools, one to handle anterior halves and one to handle posterior halves. Additionally, we wash pokers in 70% EtOH between slices

components.data: PCR amplification
components.name: Section

components.data:
To amplify transposed DNA fragments, combine the following in a PCR tube:

  • 10 μL Transposed DNA
  • 5 ul 25uM Primer 1
  • 5 ul 25uM Primer 2
  • 25ul NebNext 2x Master Mix
  • 5ul of PPC

50 μL Total

 

Run PCR as follows:

 

(1) 72°C, 5 min                                          

(2) 98°C, 30 sec

(3) 98°C, 10 sec

(4) 63°C, 30 sec

(5) 72°C, 1 min

(6) Repeat steps 3-5, 5x

(7) Hold at 4°C
components.name: Description

source_data.description:

  • 10 μL Transposed DNA
  • 5 ul 25uM Primer 1
  • 5 ul 25uM Primer 2

50 μL Total

 

Run PCR as follows:

(3) 98°C, 10 sec

(4) 63°C, 30 sec

(5) 72°C, 1 min

(6) Repeat steps 3-5, 5x

(7) Hold at 4°C

components.name: Section

components.data:
Make sure the cell pellet is set on ice.

 

To make the transposition reaction mix, combine the following:

 

Sample

20 halves- 10 embryos

2x TD Buffer-

25

Tn5 Enzyme

7.5

H20/ DNA

17.5

Total

50

source_data.reagent_name: Nextera DNA library preparation kit 24 samples

components.data: Gently pipette to resuspend nuclei in the transposition reaction mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently pipette to resuspend nuclei in the transposition reaction mix.

components.data: Incubate the transposition reaction at 37°C for 30 min. Immediately following transposition, purify using a Qiagen MinElute Kit.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the transposition reaction at 37°C for 30 min. Immediately following transposition, purify using a Qiagen MinElute Kit.

components.data: Freezing and Slicing embryos
components.name: Section

components.data: Chill a cold block in the -80 for at least 30 minutes. Once it's cold, place in a box surrounded by dry ice to keep it cool while you slice
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Chill a cold block in the -80 for at least 30 minutes. Once it's cold, place in a box surrounded by dry ice to keep it cool while you slice

source_data.reagent_name: Corning® CoolRack CF15, Holds 15 Cryovial or FACS Tubes (Product #432049)

components.data:
Purified DNA can be stored at -20°C

 

I quantify DNA at this point with the qubit.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Purified DNA can be stored at -20°C

 

I quantify DNA at this point with the qubit.

components.data: Optional - QPCR
components.name: Section

components.data:
You can stop at this point and run a small qPCR reaction to calculate the number of additional cycles to use to avoid overamplification.

 

 

Take out 5 ul of PCR reaction and run the qPCR reaction with the same conditions.

 

5 μL Transposed DNA

0.25 ul 25uM Primer 1

0.25 ul 25uM Primer 2

5ul  NebNext 2x Master Mix

3.9 ul of H20

0.09 100x Sybr Green I Dye 

_______________________

15 μL Total

 

Put in the QPCR machine and run: 

 

1 cycle: 30 sec 98° C

20 cycles: 10 sec 98° C

               30 sec 63° C

                 1 min 72° C.

 

To calculate the additional number of cycles needed, plot linear Rn (fluorescence) versus cycle and determine the cycle number that corresponds to one-third of the maximum fluorescent intensity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
You can stop at this point and run a small qPCR reaction to calculate the number of additional cycles to use to avoid overamplification.

 

 

Take out 5 ul of PCR reaction and run the qPCR reaction with the same conditions.

 

5 μL Transposed DNA

0.25 ul 25uM Primer 1

0.25 ul 25uM Primer 2

5ul  NebNext 2x Master Mix

3.9 ul of H20

0.09 100x Sybr Green I Dye 

_______________________

15 μL Total

 

Put in the QPCR machine and run: 

 

1 cycle: 30 sec 98° C

20 cycles: 10 sec 98° C

               30 sec 63° C

                 1 min 72° C.

 

To calculate the additional number of cycles needed, plot linear Rn (fluorescence) versus cycle and determine the cycle number that corresponds to one-third of the maximum fluorescent intensity.

components.data:
Once you decide how many additional cycles to run, run the rest of the PCR :

 

(2) 98°C, 30 sec

(3) 98°C, 10 sec

(4) 63°C, 30 sec

(5) 72°C, 1 min For X cycles

(7) Hold at 4dC
components.name: Description

(7) Hold at 4dC

components.data: Ampure (or Spri) bead Cleanup
components.name: Section

components.data:
1) Bring Beads to RT

2) add 1.25x Beads, Mix well, let stand for 5 minutes

3) Put on magnet, let stand for 2 minutes

4) Wash 2x with 70% EtOH

5) Let dry for 10 minutes

7) Resuspend in 20ul H20

8) Let sit for one minute, put on magnet, take of super
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1) Bring Beads to RT

2) add 1.25x Beads, Mix well, let stand for 5 minutes

3) Put on magnet, let stand for 2 minutes

4) Wash 2x with 70% EtOH

5) Let dry for 10 minutes

7) Resuspend in 20ul H20

8) Let sit for one minute, put on magnet, take of super

components.data: Library Validation
components.name: Section

components.data:
To validate my libraries, I quantify them with qubit HS DNA and I evaluate them with the Bioanalyzer High Sensitivity DNA assay.

 

Sometimes they look like this: 

Sometimes they look like this: I usually see this when I am working with smaller amounts of embryos. Below is from one embryo half. I am not 100% sure what this means (whether it's actually undertagmented or what) but when I sequenced this sample the data was comprable to my other samples. If you have any ideas let me know! I usually try not to sequence these samples but they could be perfectly fine.
